page.title: 11CROFTON SCHOOLS, ORPINGTON
page.content: {Crofton School} was built in 1936. It was first called Crofton Lane School. In Crofton Junior School at present there are about 760 children. In the 1970s the school was at its largest. There were in the Infant and Junior schools about 1500 children altogether. At first both schools were at what we now call the annexe. In 1950 the infants had their own school built on the other side of the road. They also had their own head teacher. In 1967 the Juniors had a school built next to the Infants school. As far as we know we are {the largest Infant and Junior schools in England}.
